questions.answer_text: c) Push PB2 then release it, and then push PB4.

options.text: A roller lever switch that only actuates piston 2A's retraction.

Pneumatic Circuit - What will happen to Piston 1A in this pneumatic diagram when the pushbutton 1S is pressed? Assume air supply switch 0S is switched on.

options.text: a) Piston 1A will extend with air flowing from air port 1 to port 2 through the valve 1S
Piston 1A will extend with air flowing from air port 1 to port 3 through the valve 1S
Piston 1A will retract with air flowing from air port 1 to port 2 through the valve 1S

questions.answer_text: a) Piston 1A will extend with air flowing from air port 1 to port 2 through the valve 1S

questions.answer_text: c) electrically isolate the processor circuitry from the inputs and outputs

What is the purpose of the dashed line connecting the NC PB1 contacts of rungs 1 and the NO contacts of rung 5?

options.text: a) The dashed line represents a mechanical interlock between the electrical contacts of PB1 NC and PB1 NO, which are shown on rungs 1 and 5.
The dashed line represents a mechanical interlock between the electrical contacts of IL1 and IL2, which are shown on rungs 2 and 4.
It means nothing at all, but is a convenient way to show how a light might be energized.

questions.answer_text: a) The dashed line represents a mechanical interlock between the electrical contacts of PB1 NC and PB1 NO, which are shown on rungs 1 and 5.

options.text: a) Piston 1A will extend with air flowing from air port 1 to port 2 through the valve 1S

questions.answer_text: a) Piston 1A will extend with air flowing from air port 1 to port 2 through the valve 1S
